text: it's not like drugs it's not like crack
but it is an addiction
it's a healthful addiction because
that's going to make your brain bigger
and it's going to make you more capable
of tackling life
I've always been a puzzle head started
solving them when I was a kid I devised
the whole curriculum and puzzles and I
have the world's only college degree in
enigma Tala JEE every day for me is a
little different but generally speaking
the things I do is New York Times
crossword editor first of all look at
submissions I get 75 to 100 puzzles in
it in a week I am a very hands-on editor
on average about half the clues and The
Times crossword or mine the platter is
not poo poo what you have to say is
blank platter I'm editing first of all
for accuracy everything has to be
correct I've got my most used reference
books on the shelves in front of me with
a World Almanac a Collegiate Dictionary
Movie Guide proper names literature if I
just want to find out what's the usage
you know how common is a phrase does
this make a great crossword entry I'll
just do a google search on the phrase
and it'll tell me how many uses there
are when I accept a puzzle
I immediately slated for a particular
day of the week so Monday is the easiest
and it builds up to very hard on Friday
and Saturday after the puzzles are
edited they are typeset we send them to
three test solvers one of whom rechecks
every word in fact after me all the
solvers call in with their comments and
corrections I polish the puzzles so
every time crossword is seen bingo and
tested by a lot of people before it
appears in print I'm not a singer and
not a good magician and you know can't
do a high-wire act but I think I'm good
at crafting a puzzle and writing clues
